Key Match Events: Eric Wagaman scored on Jordyn Adams' infield hit in the 13th inning, giving the Angels a 4-3 victory against the Sox at Angel Stadium.
Andrew Benintendi's two-out RBI single gave the Sox a 2-1 lead in the 11th inning.
Gustavo Campero tied the game with a run-scoring single in the bottom of the 10th inning.
Wagaman hit an RBI single in the 12th inning to tie the game.
Jake Eder made his major-league debut in the 5-0 loss to the Angels on September 17, 2024.
Chad Kuhl found a way in a tricky spot, avoiding a run-scoring balk in the 7th inning on Monday.
Post-Match Reflections: Interim manager Grady Sizemore said the Sox had some opportunities, just didn’t capitalize on them, and came up short.
Jake Eder said he was trying to stay as relaxed as possible and stay within himself in his major-league debut.
Chad Kuhl said it was a do-or-die moment in the 7th inning on Monday, and he executed a pitch to get out of the jam.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Sox lost two of three to the Angels, but had their chances.
The Sox are three shy of tying the 1962 New York Mets for the most losses in a season during the modern era.
The Sox still haven’t won a road series since May 3-5 in St. Louis.
The Sox used eight pitchers on Wednesday, with Adams getting the game-winning hit against Jairo Iriarte.
Others: The game took 3 hours and 35 minutes to complete.
Yoán Moncada struck out in his first major-league at-bat since April 9, and the Sox stranded the bases loaded in the 13th inning.
Andrew Vaughn homered in the 4th inning for the game’s first run.
Taylor Ward tied the game with an RBI single in the 8th inning.
The Angels made the most of their opportunity in the 13th, and the Sox suffered another tough loss.
